definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to control/to accuse/to charge/to sue/to invert a container to empty it/(suffix) (slang) buff/enthusiast/devotee/-phile or -philia

sentences.english: She takes her finger OFF the fire-control and pulls her aircraft out of formation.
sentences.chinese: 她關閉了火控系統然後脫離了機羣。

sentences.english: It is the newest Fire Control System for turrets that integrate small to medium calibre weaponry.
sentences.chinese: 這是塔樓與中小口徑武器相結合的最新火控系統。

sentences.english: This paper introduces a method of radio netting three fire-control radars.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了將三部火控雷達進行無線組網的一種方法。

sentences.english: Photoelectric collimator is a kind of simple fire-control system equipped on a weapon system.
sentences.chinese: 光電瞄具是配備於某武器系統上的一種簡易火控系統。

sentences.english: Will realistic elements such as tank fire control systems make it into the game?
sentences.chinese: 像坦克火控系統一類的真實元素會在遊戲中出現嗎？

sentences.english: Today, communications have become a major factor in the coordination of ship and gun control.
sentences.chinese: 到今天，通信已成爲操船與火控之間協調的重要因素。

sentences.english: The radar was designed for the fire-control of the anti-ship missile and 100mm main gun targeting.
sentences.chinese: 雷達設計用於反艦導彈和100毫米主炮火控瞄準。

definition: early warning aircraft system, e.g. US AWACS
to control (the course of sth)/to guide (a missile)
